question.text: When <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msubsup></math> (1 mole) in neutral aqueous medium is disproportionate, the product obtained is

options.text: 2/3 mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo></mrow></msubsup></math> and 1/3 mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

1/3 mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo></mrow></msubsup></math> and 2/3 mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

1/3 mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub></math> and 1/3 mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

2/3 mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub></math> and 1/3 mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

solution.text:
3MnO 4 −2  +  4H +  →  2MnO 4 −  +  MnO 2  +  2H 2 O
MnO42- in neutral aqueous medium is disproportionate to 23 mole of MnO4- and 13 mole of MnO2.
